intro: Mniopsis saldanhana, commonly known as the Saldanha's mniopsis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive central disc surrounded by ray florets. Mniopsis saldanhana is often found in rocky outcrops and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
